sentence.text: In human breast cancer xenografts in humanized mice, blocking the recruitment of naive CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells into tumor by knocking down the expression of phosphatidylinositol biosynthetic process, a chemotaxis receptor, significantly reduces intratumoral Tregs and inhibits tumor progression.

Inhibiting naive CD4<sup>+</sup> T cell recruitment into tumors by interfering with phosphatidylinositol biosynthetic process recognition of CCL18 may be an attractive strategy for anticancer immunotherapy
